sentences: Ma ei tea, kas ma võiksin aidata.
Kas sa võiksid tuua mulle veeni?
context: The word 'võiksin' is the conditional first person singular form of the Estonian modal verb 'või', meaning 'can' or 'to be able'. It expresses possibility or ability in the past conditional tense, similar to 'could' or 'might' in English. This form is used when speaking about what one might have been able to do under certain conditions.
